column1: In Kannangara v. Silva 35 N.LR 1 it was declared:-

column2: "Where  a partition  decree was entered  without  a trial  and without  notice  to  the  parties  on  the
record, and  an  application was made by a person  who  was no party  to the  action  to  set aside  the

column3: the  District  Court  had  no  power  to  vacate  the  decree.  The

column2: Supreme Court would in the exercise of its powers of revision set aside a decree entered under such
circumstances and direct proceedings to be taken de novo."
